intro: Polyosma ridleyi, commonly known as the Malayan polyosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
